frame_types.service_initiation: Initial service interaction frame establishment, including greeting and service role identification
frame_types.journey_information: Travel details collection and processing, focused on destination and route
frame_types.payment_method: Payment type determination and processing, including card type verification
frame_types.payment_method_response: Customer response confirming or providing payment method details
frame_types.discount_eligibility: Discount qualification assessment, including railcard verification
frame_types.discount_eligibility_response: Customer response to discount qualification assessment
frame_types.passenger_quantity: Traveler number determination for ticket quantity calculation
frame_types.passenger_quantity_response: Customer specification of number of travelers
frame_types.journey_date: Travel date specification for outward journey
frame_types.journey_date_response: Customer provision of outward journey date
frame_types.departure_time_specification: Customer provision of preferred departure time
frame_types.location_verification: Confirmation of location details to ensure booking accuracy
frame_types.correction: Information correction and adjustment when errors are identified
frame_types.correction_acceptance: Acknowledgment and integration of corrected information
frame_types.acceptance: Affirmation and approval of provided information or suggestions
frame_types.return_information: Return journey details processing, including date and time
frame_types.return_information_provision: Customer provision of return journey details
frame_types.fare_checking: Ticket price verification and availability assessment
frame_types.acknowledgment: Basic recognition of received information without substantive response
frame_types.date_verification: Confirmation of travel dates to ensure booking accuracy
frame_types.confirmation: Explicit verification and approval of critical information
frame_types.fare_limitation: Explanation of fare availability constraints and options
frame_types.understanding: Indication of comprehension of complex information
frame_types.fare_options: Ticket pricing options and explanation, including cost-saving alternatives
frame_types.comprehension: Demonstration of understanding complex information or processes
frame_types.journey_verification: Comprehensive confirmation of all journey details
frame_types.seat_preference: Seating preference elicitation for ticket customization
frame_types.seat_preference_detailed_provision: Customer provision of detailed seating preferences
frame_types.return_journey_verification: Confirmation of return journey details for accuracy
frame_types.fare_confirmation: Final verification of ticket pricing before payment
frame_types.ticket_rules: Explanation of ticket usage rules and restrictions
frame_types.personal_information: Customer details collection for booking records
frame_types.personal_information_provision: Customer provision of personal identification details
frame_types.personal_information_continued: Continued collection of customer identification details
frame_types.personal_information_provision_continued: Customer continuation of personal details provision
frame_types.contact_information: Customer contact details collection for notifications
frame_types.contact_information_completion: Completion of contact information gathering process
frame_types.payment_information: Payment details collection for transaction processing
frame_types.address_verification: Confirmation of address details for payment processing
frame_types.payment_card_details: Specific card information collection for transaction
frame_types.payment_correction: Adjustment of payment method or details when necessary
frame_types.card_issue_number: Collection of card issue number for debit cards
frame_types.card_issue_number_provision: Customer provision of card issue number
frame_types.card_expiry: Collection of card expiry date for payment processing
frame_types.card_expiry_provision: Customer provision of card expiry information
frame_types.booking_reference: Provision of booking reference for future retrieval
frame_types.receptive_acknowledgment: Ready acceptance of provided reference information
frame_types.reference_provision: Detailed provision of booking reference information
frame_types.satisfaction: Expression of contentment with service outcome

strategy_types.frame_reinforcement: Strategies that strengthen established frames through repetition, elaboration, or emphasis
strategy_types.frame_shifting: Strategies that transform or adjust frames through transition, correction, or redirection
strategy_types.frame_blending: Strategies that integrate multiple frames to address complex information needs
strategy_types.frame_acceptance: Strategies that acknowledge and operate within established frames without alteration
strategy_types.frame_correction: Strategies that modify incorrect frame elements to restore accuracy

strategy_subtypes.role_establishment: Defining participant roles within the interaction
strategy_subtypes.directive_guidance: Structuring the interaction through direct instruction
strategy_subtypes.verification: Confirming accuracy of previously established information
strategy_subtypes.framework_expansion: Broadening the scope of the current frame
strategy_subtypes.compliance: Indicating adherence to established frame requirements
strategy_subtypes.specification: Providing detailed information within established parameters
strategy_subtypes.framework_continuation: Maintaining established frame with additional elements
strategy_subtypes.framework_specification: Adding precision to existing frame elements
strategy_subtypes.face_management: Preserving interactional harmony when errors occur
strategy_subtypes.correction_integration: Incorporating corrected information into the frame
strategy_subtypes.confirmation: Explicitly affirming frame elements or propositions
strategy_subtypes.information_provision: Supplying factual content within established frame
strategy_subtypes.interaction_management: Regulating the pace and structure of the exchange
strategy_subtypes.cooperation: Demonstrating willingness to participate in frame activities
strategy_subtypes.explanation_introduction: Beginning clarification of complex frame elements
strategy_subtypes.solution_framing: Presenting options as resolutions to identified needs
strategy_subtypes.rationale_provision: Explaining reasoning behind suggestions or requirements
strategy_subtypes.alternative_introduction: Presenting different options within service frame
strategy_subtypes.aspect_transition: Shifting between related components of the same frame
strategy_subtypes.agreement: Expressing acceptance of suggested options or information
strategy_subtypes.discourse_progression: Moving the interaction forward through transitions
strategy_subtypes.situation_definition: Establishing the current state of proceedings
strategy_subtypes.clarification: Providing additional explanation to prevent misunderstanding
strategy_subtypes.information_request: Soliciting specific information to facilitate service
strategy_subtypes.information_specification: Providing precise details within request parameters
strategy_subtypes.information_confirmation: Echoing provided information to ensure accuracy
strategy_subtypes.focus_transition: Shifting attention to different aspect of transaction
strategy_subtypes.information_verification: Checking accuracy of previously provided details
strategy_subtypes.readiness_indication: Signaling preparedness for next interaction phase
strategy_subtypes.reference_provision: Supplying identification codes for future reference
strategy_subtypes.acknowledgment: Recognizing received information without substantive response
strategy_subtypes.acceptance: Indicating agreement with proposals or information
strategy_subtypes.preference_elicitation: Soliciting customer preferences for service customization
strategy_subtypes.acceptance_indication: Showing acceptance of proposed service arrangements

negotiation_types.initiation: Frame establishment point where core interaction parameters are defined
negotiation_types.transition: Point where interaction shifts between distinct communicative frames
negotiation_types.verification: Information accuracy checking to ensure shared understanding
negotiation_types.confirmation: Explicit affirmation of proposed or established frames
negotiation_types.challenge: Direct questioning or correction of proposed frame elements
negotiation_types.adjustment: Modification of frame elements in response to identified issues
negotiation_types.comprehension: Demonstration of understanding of complex information
negotiation_types.compliance: Willing adherence to institutionally established procedures
negotiation_types.integration: Combination of multiple frames into coherent structure
negotiation_types.contrast: Juxtaposition of different frame elements for comparison
negotiation_types.transaction: Core service exchange point involving financial commitment
negotiation_types.satisfaction: Evaluation point expressing service outcome assessment
negotiation_types.correction: Adjustment of incorrect information or misunderstanding

frame_transition_types.sequential: Orderly progression through predetermined service script steps
frame_transition_types.verification: Transitioning to accuracy checking before proceeding
frame_transition_types.correction: Shifting to error rectification when inaccuracies identified
frame_transition_types.accommodation: Adjusting frame to incorporate corrected information
frame_transition_types.challenge: Disputing established frame elements requiring revision
frame_transition_types.solution: Moving to resolution-oriented framing of options
frame_transition_types.action: Transitioning from discussion to concrete service actions
frame_transition_types.confirmation: Moving to explicit verification of critical elements
frame_transition_types.information: Shifting to detailed explanation of requirements or rules
frame_transition_types.evaluation: Transitioning to assessment of service outcome

levels.1: Minimal frame activation with negligible influence on interaction
levels.2: Slight frame activation with limited interactive effect
levels.3: Moderate frame activation with noticeable but non-dominant influence
levels.4: Medium frame activation with substantial interactive presence
levels.5: Strong frame activation with pronounced influence on interaction
levels.6: Very strong frame activation with major interactive effects
levels.7: Maximal frame activation with dominant control of interaction

levels.1: Completely ineffective with failure to achieve intended effect
levels.2: Largely ineffective with minimal achievement of strategic goal
levels.3: Partially effective with limited strategic outcome
levels.4: Moderately effective with adequate goal achievement
levels.5: Substantially effective with clear strategic success
levels.6: Highly effective with strong achievement of intended outcome
levels.7: Maximally effective with complete strategic goal attainment

context_dependence.interpretation: Continuous measure of degree to which frame activation relies on immediate contextual factors rather than institutional presetting

institutional_presetting.interpretation: Continuous measure of degree to which frame activation is predetermined by institutional roles and procedures rather than emergent from context

cognitive_load.interpretation: Estimated mental effort required to process and engage with the current frame

adaptation_index.interpretation: Degree to which strategy represents adjustment to new contextual conditions rather than predetermined script

semantic_distance.interpretation: Magnitude of conceptual shift occurring at negotiation points, with higher values indicating greater transformation

contribution_ratio.interpretation: Proportional influence of service provider and customer in constructing meaning at negotiation points

transition_smoothness.interpretation: Degree of coherence and cooperativeness during frame transitions, with higher values indicating smoother shifts

strategy_type.measurement: categorical variable in JSONL index file
strategy_type.analysis_transformation: multinomial categorical with frame_reinforcement as reference

frame_type.measurement: categorical variable in JSONL index file

efficacy.hypothesis_relevance: H2 - outcome measure for strategy effectiveness

strategy_subtype.measurement: categorical variable in JSONL index file

stage.measurement: categorical variable in JSONL index file

negotiation_type.measurement: categorical variable in JSONL index file

contribution_ratio.measurement: two-element array in JSONL index file
contribution_ratio.hypothesis_relevance: H4 - measure of participant influence in meaning construction

semantic_distance.hypothesis_relevance: H4 - measure of meaning transformation magnitude

h1_manova.formula: cbind(activation_strength, cognitive_load) ~ context_dependence_category * institutional_presetting_category + speaker_role + stage + relative_position + (1|dialogue_id)

h2_logistic_regression.formula: logit(P(strategy = k) / P(strategy = 1)) = β₀ₖ + Σⱼβⱼₖ×Xⱼ + Σₘγₘₖ×Zₘ + Σₚ,ₚδₚₖ×(Xₚ × Zq) + (u₀ₖ|dialogue_id)

parameters.k: Strategy type (k=2 for frame_shifting, k=3 for frame_blending, k=4 for frame_acceptance, with frame_reinforcement k=1 as reference)
parameters.β₀ₖ: Baseline intercept for strategy type k
parameters.Xⱼ: Vector of micro-contextual factors (e.g., turn position, activation_strength, efficacy)
parameters.Zₘ: Vector of macro-institutional factors (e.g., frame_type, speaker_role, stage)
parameters.βⱼₖ: Fixed effect coefficients for micro factors
parameters.γₘₖ: Fixed effect coefficients for macro factors
parameters.u₀ₖ: Random intercept term at dialogue level

h2_logistic_regression.software_implementation: R: nnet::multinom() or lme4::glmer() with family=binomial
